ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The basic techniques used in biology and biochemistry labs were introduced at an easy-to-understand pace, with practical applications. Genuinely, the best lab course I've taken at Yale.
How to perform mutagenesis, ligation and transformation, kinetic activity assay, colorimetric assay, protein purification, SDS Page, and PCR.

Knowledge: principles of proteomics and different types of protein purification methods
Skills: biochemical laboratory skills, including micropipetting, PCR, gel electrophoresis
Insight: factors that determine protein folding and stability

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the fact that the semester was centered around a single, ongoing project helped connect experiments from week to week. I felt like a research scientist working toward a tangible end goal rather than just having sporadic experiments that didn't connect in any form or fashion.

Weaknesses: labs were often LONG (we were there until 5:00-5:30 nearly every time); sometimes lectures were tough to understand and didn't do a great job presenting the material.

The labs feel very long and sometimes the lectures are a bit difficult to understand, however the discussion questions really help with understanding the material. I did like that there was not too high of a workload outside of class except for the final lab report and midterm presentation though.

Strengths: positive work environment, reasonable workload, unifying concepts / topics for entire course
Weaknesses: day-to-day structure could be tightened up, perhaps 3h30 - 4h meeting time could be shortened

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely; a great course for anyone wanting to do research in biology/biochemistry. Teaches the fundamentals and allows for a good bit of self direction.

Yes since I think the skills you learn in this lab are very useful if youre ever going to be doing bio-related wet lab research in the future. I also feel like it better solidified my understanding of biochemistry, although not necessarily in conjunction with what I learned in lecture.
Yes, this course accompanies MB&B 300 well without adding too much work. (Also, start the final lab report before reading period.)
